item.title: Taft add a quote by Gerald R. Ford
item.description: "A government big enough to give you everything you want is a government big enough to take from you everything you have." -- Gerald R. Ford

item.title: Taft add a quote by Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: "God does not begin by asking us about our ability, but only about our availability, and if we then prove our dependability, he will increase our capability." -- Neal A. Maxwell

item.title: Taft add a quote by William Law
item.description: "If you have not chosen the kingdom of God first, it will in the end make no difference what you have chosen instead." -- William Law

item.title: Taft add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Taft add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell

item.title: Taft add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Taft add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Taft add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln
